meanings.definition: A simultaneous discharge of firearms or other weapons.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers heard the salvoed gunfire during the military parade.
meanings.sent2: The loud salvoed shots echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The salvoed cannons startled the birds in the nearby trees.
meanings.sent4: The salvoed fireworks lit up the night sky in a spectacular display.
meanings.sent5: The thunderous salvoed blasts marked the beginning of the celebration.

meanings.definition: To fire a salute or volley of shots.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers salvoed their rifles in honor of the fallen comrade.
meanings.sent2: The ship salvoed its cannons as a sign of respect.
meanings.sent3: The kids salvoed water balloons at each other on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: The team salvoed goals one after another, securing their victory.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks salvoed into the sky, painting it with bursts of color.

meanings.definition: To give a sudden release or outburst.
meanings.sent1: She salvoed a burst of laughter when she heard the joke.
meanings.sent2: The volcano salvoed ash and smoke into the air unexpectedly.
meanings.sent3: The singer salvoed a high note that surprised everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent4: His anger salvoed out in a sudden outburst of frustration.
meanings.sent5: The emotions salvoed from her heart, overwhelming her with joy.
